SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NO. 2

A part of exhibition to the province.

It is difficult to receive a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual was asked to answer it in exactly the same experiences as another.

Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer. Leaving blank spaces, "I don't know," or "not applicable" for you to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1911, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

A METHOD OF COLLECTING INFORMATION TO THE PROVINCE

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so try to answer all questions. If you cannot answer any question, please leave it blank.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or reply to a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Lists That Did Western Canadian Pioneers Enter," is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

and one will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

All questionnaires

- Pioneer health conditions
- Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
- Pioneer housing
- Pioneer education and churchwork
- Pioneer farming experience
